name: Jobs To Be Done Extractor
description: Extracts Jobs To Be Done from pain points, client facts, and user research. Generates structured JTBD document with functional, emotional, and social jobs.

frontmatter.name: Discovery_JTBD
frontmatter.description: Extracts Jobs To Be Done from pain points, client facts, and user research

rawContent:
# Discovery_JTBD

## Purpose

Transform validated pain points into actionable Jobs To Be Done using the When/Want/So-that framework. This skill analyzes client facts and pain points to generate functional, emotional, and social jobs.

## When to Use

- After pain points have been validated
- During the JTBD extraction phase of Discovery
- When user needs are not yet expressed as actionable jobs

## Workflow

1. Read pain points from `02-research/PAIN_POINTS.md`
2. Map pain points to user types
3. Generate functional jobs (What users want to accomplish)
4. Generate emotional jobs (How users want to feel)
5. Generate social jobs (How users want to be perceived)
6. Validate 100% coverage of P0 pain points

## Output

Generates `02-research/JOBS_TO_BE_DONE.md` with:
- Functional JTBD (JTBD-F-X.X)
- Emotional JTBD (JTBD-E-X.X)
- Social JTBD (JTBD-S-X.X)
- Traceability links to source pain points
purpose: Transform validated pain points into actionable Jobs To Be Done using When/Want/So-that framework

name: Persona Generator
description: Generates rich persona documents from interview transcripts with demographics, goals, pain points, and workflow patterns

frontmatter.name: Discovery_GeneratePersona
frontmatter.description: Generates rich persona documents from interview transcripts

rawContent:
# Discovery_GeneratePersona

## Purpose

Create detailed persona profiles from user research data. Each persona captures demographics, goals, frustrations, and day-in-life scenarios.

## When to Use

- After interview analysis is complete
- During persona synthesis phase
- When creating user-centered design artifacts

## Persona Structure

### Demographics
- Role and title
- Experience level
- Technical proficiency
- Team size and structure

### Goals
- Primary objectives
- Success metrics
- Career aspirations

### Frustrations
- Current pain points
- Workarounds used
- Impact on productivity

### Day-in-Life
- Typical workflow
- Tools used
- Collaboration patterns

## Output

Generates `02-research/personas/PERSONA_{Name}.md` with structured persona document.
purpose: Create detailed persona profiles from user research

name: Design System Generator
description: Generates comprehensive design token system with colors, typography, spacing, and component patterns
rawContent:
# Prototype_DesignSystem

## Purpose

Create a comprehensive design token system from Discovery design specifications. Generates colors, typography, spacing, and component patterns following Tailwind CSS v4 conventions.

## Token Categories

### Colors
- Primary palette (brand colors)
- Semantic colors (success, warning, error)
- Neutral grays
- Surface colors

### Typography
- Font families
- Font sizes (rem-based)
- Line heights
- Font weights

### Spacing
- Base unit (4px)
- Scale (0-96)
- Component-specific spacing

### Effects
- Border radii
- Shadows
- Transitions

## Output

Generates `00-foundation/design-tokens/` with:
- `colors.json`
- `typography.json`
- `spacing.json`
- `tokens.css` (CSS custom properties)
purpose: Create design tokens and component library specifications

name: React Code Generator
description: Generates React components from component specifications with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and accessibility features
rawContent:
# Prototype_CodeGenerator

## Purpose

Transform component specifications into working React code with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and accessibility features.

## Code Standards

### TypeScript
- Strict mode enabled
- Props interfaces for all components
- No `any` types

### Tailwind CSS
- Use design tokens via CSS custom properties
- Responsive utilities
- Dark mode support

### Accessibility
- ARIA attributes
- Keyboard navigation
- Focus management
- Screen reader support

## Output Structure

```
04-implementation/src/components/
├── ComponentName/
│   ├── index.tsx
│   ├── ComponentName.test.tsx
│   └── types.ts
```
purpose: Transform component specs into working React code

name: TDD Implementation Developer
description: Implements features using Test-Driven Development with Red-Green-Refactor cycle and quality validation
rawContent:
# Implementation_Developer

## Purpose

Implement production code using strict TDD methodology with Red-Green-Refactor cycle.

## TDD Cycle

### RED Phase
1. Write failing test first
2. Test must fail for the right reason
3. One test at a time

### GREEN Phase
1. Write minimum code to pass
2. No additional features
3. Run tests to verify

### REFACTOR Phase
1. Improve code quality
2. Maintain passing tests
3. Extract duplication
4. Apply SOLID principles

## Quality Gates

- Test coverage > 80%
- No TypeScript errors
- ESLint passing
- No CRITICAL findings

## Output

Generated code with:
- Unit tests (*.test.ts)
- Implementation files
- Updated traceability
purpose: Implement production code using TDD methodology

name: GDPR Compliance Assessor
description: Assesses GDPR compliance requirements, data privacy impacts, and DPIA triggers for EU data processing

frontmatter.name: GRC_gdpr-compliance
frontmatter.description: GDPR compliance assessment and DPIA evaluation

rawContent:
# GRC_gdpr-compliance

## Purpose

Evaluate GDPR compliance requirements and identify data protection requirements for EU data processing.

## Assessment Areas

### Lawful Basis
- Consent
- Contract
- Legal obligation
- Vital interests
- Public task
- Legitimate interests

### Data Subject Rights
- Right to access
- Right to rectification
- Right to erasure
- Right to portability
- Right to object

### DPIA Triggers
- Large-scale processing
- Sensitive data
- Systematic monitoring
- Automated decision-making

## Output

Generates compliance assessment with:
- Lawful basis analysis
- DPIA recommendation
- Required technical measures
- Documentation requirements
purpose: Evaluate GDPR compliance and identify data protection requirements

name: OWASP Vulnerability Scanner
description: Scans code for OWASP 2025 vulnerabilities including SQL injection, XSS, broken authentication, and IDOR
rawContent:
# SECURITY_vulnerability-scanner

## Purpose

Detect security vulnerabilities in code following OWASP 2025 guidelines.

## Vulnerability Categories

### Injection
- SQL injection
- NoSQL injection
- Command injection
- LDAP injection

### Authentication
- Broken authentication
- Session management
- Credential exposure

### XSS
- Reflected XSS
- Stored XSS
- DOM-based XSS

### Access Control
- IDOR
- Privilege escalation
- Missing authorization

## Severity Levels

- CRITICAL: Immediate exploitation risk
- HIGH: Significant security impact
- MEDIUM: Moderate risk
- LOW: Minor concern

## Output

Generates security report with:
- Vulnerability list by severity
- Code locations
- Remediation recommendations
